title: piaomiaozun
author: piaomiaozun
content: On May 19, 2010, LASZLO published a post hoping to exchange 10,000 Bitcoin for two pizza, and successfully ordered pizza on May 22, which became Bitcoin's first substantial transaction, and more than a decade later we imprinted this classic on Bitcoin's Satoshi.You can learn and collect him here.https://unisat.io/market/brc20?tick=pizzaPosts by LaszloÔºöhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=137.0

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Quote from: piaomiaozun on December 01, 2024, 04:13:52 AMYou can learn and collect him here.https://unisat.io/market/brc20?tick=pizzaYeah, we remember that guy. We have forgiven him(that is if there is anything forgive), we hope has forgiven himself and moved. Although, I feel his kids and grandkids may blame him for them missing generational wealth that is if they are not already wealth. The world is never going to forget it and at every instance, they will bring it up.I like what how the website is designed but I'm sorry, can you explain to me what it means - like, what does 300 pizza, 3,700sats/pizza, $3.56 mean in each of the cards? Thank you.

comments.author: EluguHcman
comments.body: Quote from: Davidvictorson on December 01, 2024, 04:30:53 AMQuote from: piaomiaozun on December 01, 2024, 04:13:52 AMYou can learn and collect him here.https://unisat.io/market/brc20?tick=pizzaYeah, we remember that guy. We have forgiven him(that is if there is anything forgive), we hope has forgiven himself and moved. Although, I feel his kids and grandkids may blame him for them missing generational wealth that is if they are not already wealth. The world is never going to forget it and at every instance, they will bring it up.LMAO. Sorry maybe you can remind me how the hr (Laszlo) offended us over the sold of 10,000 Bitcoin for 3 pizza's because I can not remember him rendering the house and apology and can't also remember the house tell him "Okay, we have forgiven you" üòÅThe dude has already created a legendary event and that is why the Bitcoin community in a global range could mark an event of "Bitcoin Pizza Day" on his behalf.That his action has single handedly brought about the encouragement to hold our Bitcoin patiently and while on a long run we would be opportuned to increase it value.It has also created about valuability of Bitcoin regarding it is the first¬† commerical transaction being documented using Bitcoin for payment.So¬† let us not see move to be a lost. Perhaps... It has optimized the Bitcoin community with remarkable event day that Will not be forgotten but celebrated.I don't believe Laszlo will be up to date without holding Bitcoin after the incident because he was a great Bitcoin miner who had accumulated huge amount of Bitcoin within the range of 70K Bitcoin.So the 10,000 Bitcoin for Pizza payment could be less to his holdings.He has also been one of a miner who has been up steady in experimenting to reveal the potential utilizations of Bitcoin.He is indeed a legend with his performances in the Bitcoin industry which his children and future generation would even earn the honour of what Laszlo has earlier printed in the world of crypto.So let us let him breath üòÅEmm... Less before I opt out of this post, I want to remind us that he did not lost the 10,000 Bitcoin atleast he earned it free on mining and was able to exchange it some worth eatable. OMG üò≥.Atleast compare the value of Bitcoin then. Moreover, if we live by reminding this event as a lapses, or mockery, then every holders who has sold their Bitcoins in whatever profit amounts in the past would live to regret it because Bitcoin has so long been breaking into new price increases and of course increases on market values. So therefore, it is of no shame to sell as much we don't sell at lost.

comments.author: fruktik
comments.body: So why remember this guy? What will we get out of this? Will we start making fun of him again? Well, yes, it was a long time ago. At that time, no one could have imagined that Bitcoin would gain such popularity and its price would rise sharply. Therefore, there is nothing wrong with buying two pizzas for 10k coins. Of course, it becomes offensive for such a thing, but this is our life and we tend to do such things. I feel unpleasant when they start stirring up past events. We need to think about the future and the present, and not all this.

comments.author: Mia Chloe
comments.body: Quote from: fruktik on December 01, 2024, 06:34:51 AMSo why remember this guy? What will we get out of this? Will we start making fun of him again? Well, yes, it was a long time ago. At that time, no one could have imagined that Bitcoin would gain such popularity and its price would rise sharply. Therefore, there is nothing wrong with buying two pizzas for 10k coins. Of course, it becomes offensive for such a thing, but this is our life and we tend to do such things. I feel unpleasant when they start stirring up past events. We need to think about the future and the present, and not all this.Come on mate let's have a moment of silence for someone who spent literally billions of dollars worth of bitcoin in today's value on a single purchase and for pizza at that. Well let's just say he's one big bitcoin supporter. Anyways if you read through Laszlo's profile you will find out that the popular 10k BTC purchase wasn't the only pizza purchase he made with bitcoins back then. From data I found when I read about it he actually spent around 50k BTC.Laszlo's purchase is like the highest amount of bitcoin spent on a single item although microstrategy Hodls the record of making the highest bitcoin purchase ever made 55k bitcoins. If you explore Laszlo's address you would find it mind blowing in today's value.

comments.author: Iranus
comments.body: Quote from: fruktik on December 01, 2024, 06:34:51 AMSo why remember this guy? What will we get out of this? Will we start making fun of him again? Well, yes, it was a long time ago. At that time, no one could have imagined that Bitcoin would gain such popularity and its price would rise sharply. Therefore, there is nothing wrong with buying two pizzas for 10k coins. Of course, it becomes offensive for such a thing, but this is our life and we tend to do such things. I feel unpleasant when they start stirring up past events. We need to think about the future and the present, and not all this.I don't feel bad when we talk about the past, especially the story of buying two pizzas for 10kBTC because without those transactions, there would be no people who had to sacrifice in the early days of bitcoin. We wouldn't have it today, so we should be grateful and have deep affection for them. But I will be annoyed with anyone who brings this story up again and starts mocking early investors for selling bitcoin cheaply. What guarantee is there that if we were in Laszlo's or any other early investor's shoes at that time, we wouldn't have sold our bitcoins? I bet those who are laughing at the early investors would have done the same if they knew about bitcoin at the time, or they would be the ones being laughed at in the future.

comments.author: UchihaSarada
comments.body: Quote from: piaomiaozun on December 01, 2024, 04:13:52 AMOn May 19, 2010, LASZLO published a post hoping to exchange 10,000 Bitcoin for two pizza, and successfully ordered pizza on May 22, which became Bitcoin's first substantial transaction, and more than a decade later we imprinted this classic on Bitcoin's Satoshi.It is his first trade for pizza but he did more trades and spent more than 10,000 bitcoins for pizzas.Did Laszlo Hanyecz exchange 40000 BTC for 8 pizzas, not 10000 BTC for 2 pizzas?He confirmed it in this interviewThe man behind Bitcoin Pizza Day.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: @OP, this discussion have been talked about so many times here and it doesn't seem new to many members of the forum except for forum newbies who are also new to Bitcoin but newbies can be more concerned about learn how to invest and make profit from Bitcoin and not about this topic you raised.

comments.author: Ambatman
comments.body: I doubt he would ever be forgotten as long as Bitcoin exists. Though he might have lost out on generational wealth but he did create a milestone Not to mention bitcoin acceptability wasn't as common as today. Though a loss, something else was gained. @OP I'm quite curiousIs the topic about Laszlo or the ordinal?

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: piaomiaozun on December 01, 2024, 04:13:52 AMOn May 19, 2010, LASZLO published a post hoping to exchange 10,000 Bitcoin for two pizza, and successfully ordered pizza on May 22, which became Bitcoin's first substantial transaction, and more than a decade later we imprinted this classic on Bitcoin's Satoshi.You can learn and collect him here.https://unisat.io/market/brc20?tick=pizzaPosts by LaszloÔºöhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=137.0The BTC-community will always remember this event, especially now that there is a bitcoin pizza day. It is impossible to underestimate the significance of buying these 2 pizzas for 10,000 BTC, because it was the first trade and monetary transaction for bitcoin with the purchase of something physically tangible. On that day, bitcoin was used exactly as its creator intended: as a means of payment.Isn't that why you created this topic, to advertise the 1st link? I had my suspicions about this.

comments.author: EFS
comments.body: Quote from: piaomiaozun on December 01, 2024, 04:13:52 AMWho remembers LASZLO exchanging 10,000 bitcoins for two pizzas?Umm, everybody? You realize you are posting in Bitcointalk, right?Quote from: piaomiaozun on December 01, 2024, 04:13:52 AMwe imprinted this classic on Bitcoin's Satoshi.You can learn and collect him here.https://unisat.io/market/brc20?tick=pizzaWhat is this shxt and what does it have to do with Bitcoin?Quote from: piaomiaozun on December 01, 2024, 04:13:52 AMPosts by LaszloÔºöhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=137.0What's the point of reopening a new thread here when it has already happened here? Except to advertise the garbage you're trying to get people to buy.
